page.title: 14A BOURNE SCHOOLGIRL'S DAY
page.content: {My}alarm wakes me at an early hour and I get up and brace myself for the day ahead. I am thirteen years old and study at Bourne Grammar School which, like any other school day, starts with breakfast and my friend calling for me, on her bicycle, at about 8.40. {Lessons}begin after registration and usually go quite well. The best part of the day is when we go into our canteen for lunch, with a constant murmur of people discussing their morning's work. Lessons include Maths. English,Sciences,French,Humanities. {When}afternoon lessons are over it is usually all "hurly-burly" in the bicycle sheds as pupils try to hurry home to get on with their homework. The radio and a drink are the first things I need. After tea I relax in front of the television with a bag of crisps and then to bed.
